title.narrative: Strengthening camp coordination and camp management mechanisms with a focus on drought displaced populations in (North and South) Galkayo.

description.narrative:
The project will provide a CCCM Cluster focal person/officer who will convene regular cluster meetings in collaboration with UNHCR and relevant government authorities. The cluster meetings will carry out analysis of needs and intervention gaps within the IDP settlements and marshal support to respond to these needs. DRC, through the cluster focal person will gather site level information from the various stakeholders working in the IDP settlements in addition to developing and updating a master list of sites/settlements with IDP habitation. This will inform the establishment of 3W of partners operating in settlements and corresponding profiles for key sites. The focal person will also represent agencies in Galkayo in the national cluster level meetings in Mogadishu.
DRC will monitor service delivery in the IDP settlements to ensure to identify any service gaps and overlaps of interventions by implementing agencies. The project will map out existing governance structures and focal points for IDP settlements in Galkayo. Where the governance structures exist, they will be strengthened, whereas where these are found to be absent, the project will facilitate their establishment. This project will also provide capacity building of the local camp governance structures/focal points to enhance their effectiveness. A collaborative approach with protection stakeholders will be put in place to coordinate the establishment and efficient use of referral pathways for both protection concerns especially SGBV, child abuse and service delivery to persons with special needs.
The project will strengthen a two way exchange of feedback between the cluster and implementing partners on one hand and targeted beneficiaries on the other hand. To this end, the project will reinforce traditional community feedback mechanisms and establish new ones through set up of community centres where concerns by beneficiaries will be received and information disseminated. This will also be achieved by activating mobile outreach teams who will conduct occasional information awareness campaigns. To set up community centres DRC will engage IDPs in cash for work schemes to enable vulnerable households to access temporary employment. A similar CFW approach will be used to undertake camp clean ups and in the maintenance of any broken down facilities within the camp.
Although the object of this project is not to provide services to IDPs, where the situation of IDPs is determined to be of emergency nature, the project may supplement the work of the main service delivery actors by providing emergency services such as solar lights rehabilitation, torches distribution and referrals. DRC will ensure that regular joint assessments are carried out to establish such emergency needs and to generate information to be used to advocate for the urgent needs of vulnerable IDPs.
